Literature Review: Grasp learning has emerged as a crucial aspect of robotics, revolutionizing the way robots interact with their environment. The ability to grasp novel objects from unstructured piles of clutter was once considered a significant research challenge. However, advancements in machine learning and computer vision have enabled the development of robust grasp learning models. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of the art in grasp learning research, highlighting the different methodological approaches and machine learning models used.
